headline: Amazon snaps 9-day losing streak during which it lost more than $450 billion in value
summary: Amazon expects to spend $200 billion this year on AI initiatives, the company said when it reported earnings.

headline: Palo Alto Networks slumps 6% as third quarter profit guidance falls short
summary: The cybersecurity company also said on Tuesday that it's buying Israeli startup Koi

headline: Nvidia is partnering with major Indian VC firms in search for the country's next AI start-ups
summary: Nvidia is expanding its partnerships in India, including with venture capital firms, as it bets on the country's AI ecosystem that has drawn massive Big Tech investments.

headline: CNBC's The China Connection newsletter: Businesses scramble to reach China's growing experiences economy
summary: From a new theme park to business partnerships, companies are trying new ways to reach China's consumer ahead of the Lunar New Year.

headline: Japan exports growth surges to over 3-year high, up nearly 17% in January, as shipments to China soar
summary: Value of exports to China, Japan's largest trading partner, jumped 32%, after rising 5.6% in December.

headline: IMF urges Japan to keep raising rates, avoid reducing sales tax
summary: The recommendation came as dovish Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's landslide election win heightens market attention to whether she will push back against further rate hikes.

headline: Meta expands Nvidia deal to use millions of AI chips in data center build-out, including standalone CPUs
summary: Meta expands partnership with Nvidia in a deal likely worth tens of billions, for deploying millions of GPUs and new standalone CPUs in AI data centers

headline: The January CPI inflation report is due out Friday morning. Here's what it's expected to show
summary: Investors got some good news this week on the state of the labor market, and more may be on the way Friday on inflation.

headline: Tariff revenue soars more than 300% as U.S. awaits Supreme Court decision
summary: The U.S. government in January ran up a smaller deficit than a year ago, while tariff collections surged.

headline: Here are the five key takeaways from the January jobs report
summary: The January nonfarm payrolls report beat Wall Street expectations in both job creation and the unemployment rate.

headline: U.S. payrolls rose by 130,000 in January, more than expected; unemployment down to 4.3%
summary: Job growth was stronger than expected to start 2026, providing some relief to concerns about the state of the U.S. labor market.

headline: The delayed January jobs report will be released Wednesday. Here's what to expect
summary: Economists expect that the nonfarm payrolls report should show growth that was nil or not much better during the month.

headline: Disappointing holiday season: December retail sales were flat, falling well short of estimate
summary: Consumer activity slowed sharply for the December holiday shopping season.

headline: Layoffs in January were the highest to start a year since 2009, Challenger says
summary: With the recent narrative centering on a no-hire, no-fire labor market, the data suggests that the layoff part of the equation could be stepping up.

headline: China's Xi reasserts Taiwan stance in call with Trump, while U.S. president pushes trade
summary: Beijing stressed Taiwan is the most important issue while Trump highlights the trade aspects of the bilateral relations.

headline: January jobs report will be released on Feb. 11 after shutdown delay
summary: The January jobs report delayed by the brief government shutdown will be released next week, the Bureau of Labor Statistics said Wednesday.

headline: Friday's jobs report will be delayed because of the partial government shutdown
summary: Following last year's record shutdown, the BLS also was forced to delay a number of its releases.

headline: Nvidia’s new Meta deal may not be great news for these other tech stocks
summary: Shares of Broadcom, AMD and Arista fell after Nvidia and Meta announced an expansion of their partnership.

headline: China Hits Renewable Milestone, But Coal Isn’t Going Anywhere
